DESCRIPTION: +ACI-Have a database (native to the app) to save the HIT title and requester name for completed HITS.  Right now
CHALLENGE: workers use a script called HIT Database but it's unclear when it will be functional with the new worker site.  This is one of the must have scripts for workers so it would be critical to have this feature on a dedicated mobile app.+ACI-
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

column9: Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: +ACI-Tie in the app with a dedicated forum that helps people learn how to use their mobile device or tablet more effectively on the platform.  On that note
CHALLENGE: ensure that the tutorials for this app are easy to understand.  The platform is confusing enough (especially for new workers who may be younger and more accustomed to working from their mobile device).  This can be done but it's going to take a lot of work.+ACI-
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: +ACI-I would like to see a way to view all of the hits in your Que that are assigned to you without leaving the hit that I am working on. So basically
CHALLENGE: viewing the 'hits assigned to you' page should work as a template that can overlay on top of whatever page you are working on doesn't interrupt the hit your working on it only overlays the names of the hits and some shortcuts to get to each on top of the screen like a pop up menu would.+ACI-
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: +ACI-One hugely favorable feature would be a built in scraper. To turk effectively right now
CHALLENGE: we need multiple screens with scrapers going on each. The app should have a scraper set in the background that is constantly running that natively pulls turkopticon scores so it makes grabbing a hit easy. The biggest issue with mturk is taking the risk on a poor requester. The scraper needs to do everything the desktop version does
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): but more. Maybe send small notifications up that a HIT is found that meets certain criteria that is user defined.+ACI-
column6: Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: +ACI-A sightly tougher option would be to maybe implement some web interfaces. Hitnotifier.com would take some of the complexity out of the scraper option as the notifier website is essentially scraped hits already. the ability to do grab those hits directly would be super nice. In addition
CHALLENGE: have a PANDA option where the user can see a hit that they didnt get previously
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): but set it aside in the event they can grab it later. These are HUGE features that the desktop version has that if implemented well
column6: would revolutionize mobile turking.+ACI-
column7: Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: I think a features with the scripts that we use on the computer will be awesome. I like MTS which allows a person to be able to catch hits and find hits. I also think that typing for certain surveys are thinks that require a lot of typing should have some type of auto completion feature. This will make it easier when completing task on a mobile device. I think that a feature that allows the user to view the requester ratings so that the user know if the requester is going to pay or if the hit is not worth the pay. Some requester takes advantage of people.
CHALLENGE: Brainstorm Features for Mturk Mobile App

DESCRIPTION: +ACI-The mobile app should/will need to integrate directly with qualtrics. Right now
CHALLENGE: it launches external pages/tabs within a browser which makes things very difficult and time consuming. Overtime
LENGTH(DESCRIPTION): the ability to run qualtrics/survey monkey natively will need to be addressed. It would be nice that once i get to the final page in qualtrics
column6: If i had a button that I could press and it would submit the code back into mTurk and submit the HIT rather than me having to manually copy the code over. On the desktop
column7: this is the end of the world
